text: The Château de Juigné is an historic castle in Juigné-sur-Sarthe, Sarthe, Pays de la Loire, France.French Ministry of Culture: Château de Juigné ==History== The castle was built in the 17th century for the Le Clerc de Juigné family.Juigné-sur-Sarthe: History In 1680, Jacques Le Clerc de Juigné left his Château de Verdelles in Poillé-sur-Vègre, also in Sarthe, for this new castle.Verdelles: La famille Le Clerc de Juigné It was partly demolished in 1832, and subsequently rebuilt from 1918 to 1940. In the first half of the 20th century, it was the private residence of Jacques Le Clerc de Juigné, a politician, and his wife, Madeleine Le Clerc de Juigné, an heiress to the Schneider-Creusot fortune. ==References== ==External links== *Historic postcards Category:Châteaux in Sarthe
title: Château de Juigné
